string-array.name: vis_hike_info
string-array.item:
Hike Difficulty: Medium


	The Lanikai Pillboxes, or Kaiwa Ridge Trail is a short but steep uphill hike that leads you to an old military pillbox. 
		The trail is 1.8 miles and can be quite rocky at points, there are no guardrails so it can be difficult for children. 
		The top of the ridge provides a great viewpoint, letting you see many island attractions including, Kaneohe Bay, Chinaman's Hat, Waimanalo Bay, and the Makapu'u Lighthouse. 
		The hike can be quite popular so be prepared to meet other people on the trail.

Hike Difficulty: Medium

		The Maunawili Falls is a valley hike, taking you through the forest and across streams to reach a small 20ft waterfall. 
		The hike is 2.5 miles but has both uphill and downhill sections. 
		After periods of rain the hike can be extremely muddy and slippery so pay attention to weather forecasts. 
		You can swim in the pool and even jump off the top of the waterfall, but be safe!

Hike Difficulty: Hard


	The Stairway to Heaven or Haiku Stairs is one of the most well known hikes on Oahu. 
		It is a staircase with 3922 steps built in 1942 that ascends Ko'olau Mountain. 
		The main entrance to this hike has been blocked due to damage to the stairs, going this route is currently ILLEGAL and has a $1000 fine. 
		To do this hike legally you must go along Moanalua Trail until you reach the top of the ridge, this will put you at the top of the stairway from the back. Do not descend the stairway as this will take you to the illegal entrance, return back down the mountain using the same Moanalua trail. 
		If done during sunrise or sunset this hike has some of the most beautiful views Oahu has to offer.

string-array.name: res_hike_info
string-array.item:
Hike Difficulty: Hard


	The Koko Head Stairs, or Koko Crater Trail, is a long uphill hike that takes you to the top of the Koko Crater, a 1208ft high volcanic tuff cone. 
		The stairs are actually old railroad tracks that go up the Crater. 
		There are a total of 1050 of these tracks! 
		Watch out for the bridge section of the hike, where the tracks act as a bridge over a 40ft drop. 
		The hike is short, ranging from 30min to 1hour but can be quite tiresome, be sure you stretch your knees!

Hike Difficulty: Medium


	Manoa Falls trail is a short 1.7 mile hike through Manoa valley that leads to a large 150ft waterfall. 
		A popular tourist hike, Manoa Falls has been featured in many movies and TV shows including, Jurassic Park, Hunger Games, and Lost. 
		After periods of rain the hike can be extremely muddy and slippery so pay attention to weather forecasts. 
		Do not attempt to hike around and climb to the top of the waterfall as it can be very dangerous.

Hike Difficulty: Easy


	The Makapu'u Lightshouse trail is an easy cement paved trail that traces along Oahu's southeastern coastline. 
		The trail is out in the open with no cover and can be quite sunny, but has an amazing view of the ocean. 
		A great hike for kids or families, you can even push a stroller up the trail. Leashed pets are allowed. 
		It is a short 2 miles round trip trail that takes you to a lighthouse built in 1909, it has the largest light of any lighthouse in the entire USA.
